Christopher DuBois

Data scientist at GraphLab

Stochastic Collapsed Variational Bayesian Inference for Latent Dirichlet Allocation

    James Foulds, Levi Boyles, Christopher DuBois, Max Welling, Padhraic Smyth
    To appear in KDD 2013

Stochastic blockmodeling of relational event dynamics

    Christopher DuBois, Carter Butts, Padhraic Smyth.
    AI STATS 2013 [paper]

Statistical Models for Exploring Individual Email Communication Behavior

    Nicholas Navaroli, Christopher DuBois, Padhraic Smyth.
    ACML 2012. [paper]

Waiting for a retweet: modeling waiting times in information propagation

    Emma Spiro, Christopher DuBois, Carter Butts.
    NIPS 2012 Workshop on Social Media and Social Networks. [paper] (Winner of the Best Student Paper Award)

Windows into Relational Events: Data Structures for Contiguous Subsequences of Edges

    Michael J. Bannister, Christopher DuBois, David Eppstein, Padhraic Smyth.
    SODA 2013. [preprint]

Hierarchical Models for Relational Event Sequences

    Christopher DuBois, Carter T. Butts, Daniel McFarland, Padhraic Smyth.
    Journal of Mathematical Psychology [paper, arXiv]

Latent Set Models for Two-Mode Network Data

    Christopher DuBois, James Foulds, Padhraic Smyth.
    Fifth International AAAI Conference on Weblogs and Social Media. ICWSM 2011. [paper]

A Dynamic Relational Infinite Feature Model for Longitudinal Social Networks

    James Foulds, Arthur U. Asuncion, Christopher DuBois, Carter T. Butts, Padhraic Smyth. Fourteenth International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics (AI Stats 2011). [paper]

Modeling Relational Events via Latent Classes

    Christopher DuBois, Padhraic Smyth.
    For KDD 2010 (ie. the Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining 2010), I explored an LDA-like model for relational event data and evaluated its predictive accuracy on several datasets. [paper, video]

A multiple time-scale computational model of a tumor and its micro environment

    Christopher DuBois, Farnham J, Aaron E, Radunskaya A.
    To be published in Mathematical Biosciences and Engineering, Vol.10, 2013.

Large capture-range of a single-beam gradient optical trap

    Perry Schiro, Christopher DuBois, and Alfred Kwok. Optics Express, 2003. [paper] [video]
